Despite Privado's crowing about protecting oneself against cybercriminals and preventing censorship, this is just another clone-a-startup based in London and domiciled in a fiscal paradise, with all of the worst of 2020s tech practices. Marketing bombardment; a labyrinthine site that always seems to end up on the upgrade page, whatever your status as a user; oh, and a friendly "we know where you live" map of your house when you try to cancel (for which you have to fill in a lengthy form only for them to email you a public but impossible-to-find link to a subpage of the site).I signed up to be able to watch streaming services (I doubt the Russian and Chinese journalists who actually make valuable use of VPNs have the time to tolerate the incessant marketing from a company like Privado), and the playback was nice and snappy during the free trial. Of course, with 2023 data rates, the 10GB was exhausted within 3 hours, so after following the link to "Activate Limited Speed" (supposed to be available after the full-speed data is used), which lo, dumped me on the upgrade page, they got what they wanted and I signed up for a premium month. I cancelled immediately (the subscription autorenews after a month and there is no option to choose for it not to), and then began the slowdowns. Sites that previously streamed smoothly now require reduced quality settings, reproduced after several reboots of the VPN.I suggest looking elsewhere.

ZERO.I feel absolutely cheated upon with no ways to talk to anyone on their part who would actually give me my money back.They take your money but when problems arise they do not give it back to you, even if it's entirely their fault.My advice is: STAY AWAY.P.S before anyone tries the "we could not locate your account" or other ways to discredit this review this is the ticket number#PRV00151639And I could paste the emails if necessary...EDIT AFTER PRIVADO'S REPLYExactly what I said."Our service does not prohibit the viewing of said website, however, we are aware that some sites and services have implemented measures that would prevent their content from being viewed while connecting to our VPN"Update or not your service is NOT delivering what promised. Review.Titre: Okay VPN but the company has questionable practices
Review.Contenu: The VPN is fine and works well without any further issues. I like the interface is small and not so in your face. What I really disliked is how difficult it is to cancel your subscription once you no longer want the service. There is no information on your website about cancelling, not even on the Support section, apart from a very misleading answer on your FAQ about cancelling through third party websites, which doesn’t apply to most people. After much digging on My Account, I finally saw a pale gray, almost white Cancel Subscription button at the very bottom of the Billing page. All in all, it took me about half an hour to cancel my subscription due to your deceiving practices. This is very sneaky and almost unethical. Because of this, I will not be using your services again in the future. Thank you.

I subscribed to PrivadoVPN several months ago. Despite not being able to use the kill switch (which immediately disconnects me from the internet), I was pleased with PrivadoVPN. (And no, "support" did not give me a solution to this.) So I use it without the kill switch being activated. The download speed is approximately the same as I receive from my ISP.Then they recently notified me of an "upgrade" which is basically support for Russian and Chinese. I do NOT want to "upgrade." I sent support@privadovpn the following:I use privado vpn on two Win 10 computers. Every time I turn on the computers, I get the upgrade nag screen. I don't want to upgrade--I don't want Russian, China, etc. How can I keep this annoying nag screen from popping up every time? I click "remind me later" but that doesn't do any good either.The first response was that no, I am not able to stop the nag popup. Then a second response was: "If you prefer not to install the update with the extended language support, please visit Privado app's Settings > Application > and under "Update automatically" , remove the green tick."That "solution" didn't work.I am NOT PLEASED that can't opt out of the nagging me to "upgrade." Please, PrivadoVPN, do not post the canned response that you send everyone else..."we're sorry, etc., contact us..." I have already contacted support.Update on 8/17/23 - Trustpilot notified me that PrivadoVPN wanted information "about my account" or my review would be removed within 3 days. I did send the information. Then PrivadoVPN's response was that no, I can't get rid of the nag screen every time I try to log in. " the screen offering an update will still appear, unfortunately." ("Offering? No, demanding.)The "team" recommends installing the update--which includes Russian and Chinese. They say, "Even if you decline this current update, there will be more languages available soon; with the next updates, there will be French and Dutch added along with multiple other languages."I do NOT want Russian, Chinese, or any language except English. I am very unhappy that PrivadoVPN does not give me the freedom to avoid their intrusive, annoying nag screen in order to log in.They offered to give me an additional free month to my subscription. Big deal.Next update: Please, PrivadoVPN, just leave me alone! The kill switch issue is the least of my issues with PrivadoVPN. I don't want your "upgrades," I want the nag screen eliminated, and I am even more annoyed to keep getting your repeated unhelpful emails and messages.

Review.Titre: It has this one irksome tic
Review.Contenu: It lost one star because [on Windows 10]: when closed, it leaves behind some background processes that keep on running. They occupy a non-negligible amount of memory. Nothing I tried would end this. Meanwhile no free competitor I tried in the past exhibited that same behavior, which it so happens is something of a pet peeve. I like software that I've shut to be off. Really off. Otherwise, PrivadoVPN is pretty good. To resolve my nervousness I've been uninstalling it between uses, reinstalling when I need it. Annoying, but secure.

I used PrivadoVPN to see Dutch TV in the UK. I used it on laptop, iPad and mobile (Android). It worked nice on all these. I had trouble to get it to work on the iPad: I clicked on the server to select, but I had to click the image! Besides that, no problems. I had problems to connect to the server at the Dover docks, but probably due to restrictions there (free internet, connected to internet, but login required). Overall: no problems and only 4 stars because of the iPad issue.

Review.Titre: Speedy, easy VPN that solves No Loopback Issues when gaming.
Review.Contenu: I used this VPN to connect to an Ark server cluster that we are running locally on our internal network. Because stupid Shaw Bluecurve does not allow loopback and there is no way to enable it, we couldn't move between our cluster. People outside our network had no problems. Suggested action was to use a VPN - Privado's 10GB did the trick very nicely. The only annoying bit was having to enable and disable it each time we swapped servers...so we went ahead and paid for two years. Now, I just leave the VPN running while I play - game still runs smoothly with no lag while on the VPN. I'm happy!

This would've been fine, but I had the kill switch on, so it took me ~20 minutes just to get it off and get back on my internet. Maybe I'm just tech illiterate or something 😭 but I'd really appreciate if the kill switch feature would be shut off when you ran out of data, and maybe a notification would pop up (actually, I can't remember if one did, but I'm sure there was one that I missed). Again, it's a very good VPN, and the small issues I have with it could be overlooked.

Review.Titre: PrivadoVPN No Logging Policy Backed By Law...
Review.Contenu: Contrary to the trend I have noticed on Trust Pilot and other review platforms, where customers are hasty to submit a review like a 5 Star Review, through experience I have learned that it is important to use the product for a while and discover the kinks and flaws before providing a worthwhile opinion.I have been using PrivadoVPN close to a year, now.PrivadoVPN is my trusted VPN because by law they are not obligated to log my activities. This was a major selling point for me. And despite the occasional disconnect from the VPN, I still rate them 5 Star because they conduct themselves sincerely and professionally. If there's an issue, I can open a ticket and they will get back to me in a reasonable amount of time (within a day). However, I have come to learn that in many instances the reason for the disconnect was from my side. Because when I rebooted my computer I was able to fully access all servers normally.Their pricing is also reasonable and most importantly affordable. And when I use their service I am less concerned with online attacks, because I believe that their service is doing a good job of protecting my identity from most online predators.I am comfortable recommending them to others, because their service is consistent and I pretty much know what to expect from them.
